docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama’s target is a savings of $399 billion over 10 years from Medicare, Medicaid and other Health and Human Services programs.

headline.main: Budget Plan Sees Savings in Changes to Medicare
headline.print_headline: Budget Plan Sees Savings in Changes to Medicare

docs.abstract: Pres Obama's new budget proposes to save $399 billion over next decade from Medicare, Medicaid and other programs by Health Dept; many Medicare recipients would have to pay more for care and coverage.
docs.snippet: President Obama’s target is a savings of $399 billion over 10 years from Medicare, Medicaid and other Health and Human Services programs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Generations of the Casuso family have endured urban blight and change as they continue to call Bushwick their home.

headline.main: Through Decades of Unrest and Decay, Always Calling It Home
headline.print_headline: Through Decades of Unrest and Decay, Always Calling It Home

docs.abstract: Tatiana Schlossberg The Appraisal column notes that generations of Casuso family lived through dramatic changes. both good and bad, in Bushwick; observes Bushwick is once again filled with hard working residents and has a genuine family feel.
docs.snippet: Generations of the Casuso family have endured urban blight and change as they continue to call Bushwick their home.

docs.lead_paragraph: Washington state legalized marijuana more than two years ago, but in much of the state, there's still no place to get the sanctioned stuff: More than 100 cities and counties have banned pot businesses, making it tough to undermine the black market.

headline.main: Washington State Looks to Share Marijuana Taxes With Cities
headline.print_headline: Washington State Looks to Share Marijuana Taxes With Cities

docs.snippet: Washington state legalized marijuana more than two years ago, but in much of the state, there's still no place to get the sanctioned stuff: More than 100 cities and counties have banned pot businesses, making it tough to undermine the black market.

docs.lead_paragraph: When you have a quarter of the nation's $17 trillion economy to play with, it's inevitable that you and your political opponents will clash over what to do with the money.

headline.main: Obama's Budget: Spending Delays and Endangered Butterflies
headline.print_headline: Obama's Budget: Spending Delays and Endangered Butterflies

docs.snippet: When you have a quarter of the nation's $17 trillion economy to play with, it's inevitable that you and your political opponents will clash over what to do with the money.

docs.lead_paragraph: With patients facing greater exposure to the high cost of new medications, President Barack Obama on Monday called for government to use its buying power to squeeze drug companies for lower prices.

headline.main: Obama's Budget Targets High Cost of Cutting-Edge Drugs
headline.print_headline: Obama's Budget Targets High Cost of Cutting-Edge Drugs

docs.snippet: With patients facing greater exposure to the high cost of new medications, President Barack Obama on Monday called for government to use its buying power to squeeze drug companies for lower prices.

docs.lead_paragraph: Sure, $4 trillion sounds like a lot.

docs.lead_paragraph: Any tourist guide to Portland will tell you about the strip clubs.

headline.main: Oregon Strippers Lobby for Better Work Conditions
headline.print_headline: Oregon Strippers Lobby for Better Work Conditions

docs.lead_paragraph: Why would I want to grow old and die, all alone, in my own house?
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by author and musician Bert Stratton makes case for nursing homes, where he often plays music with his band Yiddishe Cup; notes he frequently plays at same nursing home his mother died in, saying she enjoyed engaging in activities there; suggests being around others in old age is far preferable to living alone.
docs.snippet: Why would I want to grow old and die, all alone, in my own house?

docs.lead_paragraph: In today’s economic and political environment, dismissing the here and now is craven and irresponsible.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column welcomes Pres Obama's proposed budget, which calls for increased spending after years of cuts; holds it signals change of focus of federal policy toward addressing immediate challenges instead of long-term goals; argues that focusing on long run, which many frame as courageous, in fact is tantamount to ignoring difficult but pressing issues.
docs.snippet: In today’s economic and political environment, dismissing the here and now is craven and irresponsible.

docs.lead_paragraph: Four million adults in the 22 states that did not expand Medicaid earn too much for that program but too little to receive federal subsidies for coverage.

headline.main: Piling On Work to Escape Gap in Health Law
headline.print_headline: Piling on Work to Escape Gap in Health Law

docs.abstract: Millions of Americans are forced to take on second and third jobs to escape gap in Affordable Care Act; low-income adults who live in states that have declined to expand Medicaid under health care law often earn too little money to receive federal aid for buying private health insurance and too much to qualify for Medicaid.
docs.snippet: Four million adults in the 22 states that did not expand Medicaid earn too much for that program but too little to receive federal subsidies for coverage.
